articles.title: Putting Cameron Winter and the TikTok Hugh Jackman Impression Guy In A Vibrato Off
articles.description: According to a 2006 Urban Dictionary post, vibrato is "a singing technique to give a voice a vibrating sound." A 2017 definition of the term defines vibrato as "a slang for masturbation." Etymologic timing is fascinating. I would say I don't know how so much could change over 11 years, but that's the amount of time it's been since I graduated from the Questrom School of Business at Boston University and I still haven't landed a job at Lockheed Martin or even a Patagonia fleece vest at that.
articles.content:
According to a 2006 Urban Dictionary post, vibrato is “a singing technique to give a voice a vibrating sound.” A 2017 definition of the term defines vibrato as “a slang for masturbation.” Etymologic timing is fascinating. I would say I don’t know how so much could change over 11 years, but that’s the amount of time it’s been since I graduated from the Questrom School of Business at Boston University and I still haven’t landed a job at Lockheed Martin or even a Patagonia fleece vest at that. At least I’ll always have my nicotine addiction.

My name is Luke and I am the 33-year old founder, manager, CEO, CFO, CMO, and CCO of Woke Wrestling, an indie wrestling ring in Woburn, Massachusetts. I first entered the indie wrestling scene in May 2014 following the Solange and Jay-Z elevator incident and my graduation from BU. I was left with a degree my parents forced me to get, a general lack of passion, no will to keep going, empty pockets because of a mulch scam I fell for (can’t talk about that one), and, again, my crippling nicotine addiction. Depressed and drained, I opened my Twitter to the video of Solange in that gown absolutely rocking Jay-Z’s shit, passionately upholding the unbreakable bonds of sisterhood between her and Beyoncé and subsequently, between us all. And then, eureka. I was going to open a space that did exactly what Solange did: promote togetherness and community through friendly and accountable physical force, complete with “I Met God, She’s Black” t-shirts up front.

Woke Wrestling was an instant hit. We attracted hipsters, WASPs, and self-identifying metrosexuals all around the greater New England area with events like “Hannah Horvath v. Marnie Michaels”, “Headlocks4Hillary”, and “Pronoun Throwdown”. However, business has dwindled in recent years. Our most recent event, which was marketed as a sequel to Clairo’s “Juna” music video, tried to appeal to a younger, Gen Z audience. It was a total “flop”, as the kids say. We learned the hard way what it was to move past the millennial market; about 200 bisexual girls and straight men seeking bisexual girlfriends showed up expecting Clairo herself to be in attendance. When she wasn’t, the youngins immediately got to TikTok and began verbally assaulting me on live, calling me horrid things like “chopped”, “unc”, and “washed”, which I later learned were ageist and uglyist slurs.

I hadn’t felt so beaten down and demeaned since those dark days in 2014. That is until a buddy of mine from college, who is now a balding freelance music journalist, sent me a link to a song I’ve never heard from an artist I’d never heard of. It was “$0” by Cameron Winter. In the message, he wrote: “From zero dollar man to zero dollar man! This guy and his band Geese are the future of rock music! Also are you perchance looking to move out to NYC now that the woke left? My roommates are (or were, rather XD) international first-year students at Columbia who just got their visas revoked so I am looking for a subletter. Let me know!” Upon pressing play and hearing that first angelically oscillating note, I felt the same rush I felt watching Solange beat up Jay-Z all those years ago. Eureka. I knew how I was going to win back those brutal bisexual delinquents. And also my business.

Hands trembling with anticipation, I dropped my Geek Bar, opened Instagram, and followed my new muse and business partner of sorts: Cameron Winter. Now all I had to do was reach out. Sweat beaded around my receding hairline and dripped into my mustache, ruining the spirals I had worked so hard to twist upwards that morning. After around half an hour of deliberation and heavy perspiring, I formed the message:

“Cameron if you read this im free on Thursday night and would like to hang out at my indie wrestling ring in Woburn, Massachusetts. Please respond to this and then hang out with me at my indie wrestling ring in Woburn, Massachusetts on Thursday night when I'm free”.

Perfectly balanced, open-ended, with an impartial tone. And based on his response, you’d think I got my degree from the College of Communication.

“Yeah sure”, he said.

Eureka.

The next step was finding an opponent. Someone of similar vibrato valor who also appeals to young bisexuals. In frustration and inability to think, I went to TikTok to numb my mind a bit. There, I was met with a ginger-brunette man in glasses gazing into the camera, mouth open, singing “ONCE THERE WAS A WAaAaAaYyYyYYYY”. Eureka.

The big day finally came. Both Cameron Winter and the TikTok Hugh Jackman Impression Guy were right there in front of me, in my indie wrestling ring in Woburn, Massachusetts. And with them came a line around the block of not straight people, not gay people, but bi-freaking-sexuals. And not the 2020 cuffed jeans, “Do you listen to Sweater Weather?” kind, but instead the real, true Hingelords of the year 2025. I’d done it.

The match was one of the most stunning takedowns I’d ever seen in my 11 years in the indie wrestling industry. Mr. Winter commanded the ring, brilliantly outdoing TikTok Hugh Jackman Impression Guy in vocal acrobats, slithering between pitches and constricting his opponent like a “Cobra” (Track 2 off the new Geese album). Watching him perform felt “Half Real” (Track 7 off the new Geese album), and it was clear TikTok Hugh Jackman Impression Guy would “Bow Down” (Track 9 off the new Geese album) in no time. Cameron mockingly and flippantly gave the final blow, singing, “If you want me to pay my taxes, you’re gonna have to nail me down.” TikTok Hugh Jackman Impression Guy took this as an invitation to physically nail down Mr. Winter and grabbed his luscious hair, blatantly violating the rules of this no-contact wrestling match. He had numerous loaves of bread thrown at him. And with that, Cameron Winter was the rightful vibrato victor.

And if you want me to pay my taxes, you won’t have to nail me down anymore. Woke Wrestling is officially back up on its feet. Many people say “the woke left”. But true wokers know: the woke never truly leaves. It reshapes itself. Love takes miles, love takes years. Thank you, Cameron Winter.
articles.name: Luke Albert

articles.title: When A Tour Guide Pulls Up With Their Fucking Megaphone Near The Bench Ur J Chilling At And Ur like Oh No No No No Don’t Even Think About It Girl 😂
articles.description: Picture this. You're me.
articles.content:
Picture this. You’re me. It’s a beautiful fall day, warm in the sun but cool in the shade with a slight breeze. You’ve got your airpods in, and you’re listening to Cockteau Twinks, the gay cousins of Cocteau Twins. And you are fucking Enjoying yourself. A bitch is *perfectly* dressed for the weather and you’re finally done with the week and a half that all your tests fell during. There is NOTHING on your mind, except the fat paperback you have in your messenger bag that you’re going to whip out soon and read, the fall equivalent to cracking open a cold one on the beach. There’s nothing performative about this, no siree. Just pure, unadulterated bliss.

And then you hear it. That grating voice projecting from the megaphone echoes throughout your skull before you see the throng of parents and their children who would rather die than think about college admissions for one more second. “Here you’ll see the College of Arts and Sciences! It’s full of students studying everything from archaeology to butt stuff,” the tour guide says, parking herself right next to your bench. Your. Bench.  

I’M GONNA KILL MYSELF!!!! you think to yourself as your right eye starts twitching. You think about pulling one of your classic in-close-proximity-to-a-tour-group schticks, such as pretending to be on a phone call and saying some bullshit like “she shows up very pregnant at her sister’s wedding after no one’s seen her for six months,” but no. That isn’t near enough in magnitude to the disturbance to the peace that you’re being subjected to. No, no, no, no, NO! You need something stronger. Something terrifying. Something… Lynchian.

Immediately, you start plotting. Because by God, you are a tweaker (Twin Peaks-er) and you deserve respect. You’re gonna hide cut up magazine letters under her fingernails while she sleeps. You’re gonna put a fish in her percolator. You’re gonna show up in her house as a shining vision of a white horse for a brief moment, then dissipate ominously. You’re gonna send her piece of shit dad into psychosis in which he believes himself to be Robert E. Lee. It’s that fucking serious.

Don’t try a tweaker, hoe.
articles.name: Ces Lodovico

articles.title: Carpet Muncher Meets NYC Carpet Hider — Match Made in Heaven?
articles.description: I've never really had much luck in the love department. I've gone on several Hinge dates, hoping that this finally might be the one.
articles.content:
I’ve never really had much luck in the love department. I’ve gone on several Hinge dates, hoping that this finally might be the one. It never is. I always go home, alone, a hopeless romantic stuck in a hopeless world. Now my dear reader, you may find yourself wondering: Why? Why don’t these dates ever work out? What’s wrong with you, fundamentally?

I’m just as nonplussed as you are. I’m funny, I’m cute, I’m charming. There’s only one thing that I can think of that might throw people off, and it’s my sexuality. I’ve always hated the idea of coming out. Why can’t people just love who they love, without being judged for it? Why do I have to make it a big deal about who I’m attracted to? It’s just who I am, and I can’t change that. But the bottom line is, my sexuality is a dealbreaker for most people.

To preface, I’m not gay. Thank god. But I am a part of the LGBTQC. What’s the C, you ask? Well… I’m ashamed to confess, but I’m even more ashamed that I’m ashamed of my sexuality. After all, you should be who you are, for your pride. So I’m saying this with my whole chest: I’m attracted to carpets.

I know what you’re thinking. You’re mentally ill. And to that I say, maybe I am. Everyone thought homosexuality was a mental illness until the woke left swooped in. It’s just a matter of time before everyone realizes that I, too, can’t change who I am. Just like how they call bisexuals “confs”, I too have a slur: carpet muncher. In a competition of minorities, I think I’m winning the oppression olympics. Honestly, it’d be easier if I was just gay. It’d be simpler to tell someone that I’m into the same gender than an inanimate object. I don’t want to be the guy from Big Mouth that fucks his pillow, but I’m afraid that this is the road I’m treading down.

But that’s neither here nor there. This article is about my loveless love life. One day, I had an idea. It was high time to traverse to the Big Apple, the great city of New York. I’ve never been, but I always heard the stories. Meetcutes in the metro. Dinner dates in the Financial District. Sex under a picnic blanket in Central Park. I was inspired by that guy on Tiktok who asks couples how they first met. That could be me. Whatever I’ve been lacking… whatever I’ve been searching for… I can feel it. It’s been waiting for me. It’s that empire state of mind.

And I’m happy to say – I found it. Completely on accident.

After escaping Penn Station, I found myself wandering down Eighth Ave when I came across a peculiar sight. A carpet, strung across the sidewalk beneath a layer of scaffolding. I really hate to admit this, but I felt something throb down there. I pushed the thrill away quickly, angry and embarrassed with myself. My internalized carpephobia kicks in. If I’m going to get over this… this obsession, whatever this is, I’m going to have to face it head on. Exposure therapy has GOT to be the only way.

I suck in a huge breath as I approach the carpet. It’s just as soft as I thought it would be. It’s a color between gray and brown, with a tinge that makes it appear vintage. Its curves make it seem almost human. It’s… well, I can’t put it any other way. It’s beautiful, and it drives me to tears, and not just in my eyes.

I step delicately towards it. The carpet seems to beckon me closer, with a gentle sway to its body. I’m mesmerized. I’m completely taken. I crouch down and lower my face towards it. There’s nothing I can do. I have to just give in to my impulses. I open my mouth and tenderly give the carpet a lick. Its rough texture pacifies my tongue, and soon I find myself all over it. I’m lost in the sauce.

But the strangest thing is that the carpet seems to be moving with me. With every other carpet I’ve made out with, they’ve always let me take the lead. But now, it’s like we’re dancing together. It’s like it’s alive.

So you can imagine my surprise when the carpet lets out a moan. Okay, what the fuck. Hello? I know I’m attracted to carpets, but I also know that they aren’t living beings. Carpets do not make sound, and they certainly do not release sounds of pleasure.

I scramble backwards, shaking, as the carpet begins to tremble. I look around wildly, wondering if anyone is seeing this. To my surprise, everyone is just walking past without sparing so much a glance. So I guess either I’m seeing things, or this is just a daily occurrence and I’m the weird one.

The carpet’s moans are getting even louder. By now I’m getting uncomfortable. Tentatively, I reach out again, stroking its ruffles. It calms down immediately, letting out a cooing sound as it settles. Okay. “Good carpet,” I say soothingly, continuing to pet it down. “There, there. Good boy.”

All of a sudden, a bulge appears in the carpet.

I frown. It begins to dawn on me that this may not be a normal carpet after all.

The next thing I know, the carpet flies at me. Everything turns to black as the carpet covers my vision, and I’m wrestling with it. For a split second, I wonder if this is the end. Then I yank the carpet off my face, and there’s a person sitting in front of me.


He isn’t just pretty. He’s not even beautiful. He’s kind of ugly, and yet I’m instantly, inexplicably attracted to him. My heart flutters as I realize that maybe I’m not just attracted to carpets after all. Is this my bi awakening? Is a carpet a gender?

The two of us stare at each other, a mutual understanding shared in our eyes. I know in my soul that he’s the one, and maybe I’m the one for him too.

The man smiles at me, and winks as he indicates the Home Depot behind us. “Should we take this inside?”

articles.title: Hey Girl, Are You A Ghost This Halloween? Cause Uhh… You Uhh… Hey Girl?
articles.description: lye /lī/ noun a strongly alkaline solution, especially of potassium hydroxide, used for washing or cleansing. Last week, I heard the word about a pre-Halloweekend "White Lye" frat party.
articles.content:
lye

/lī/

noun

a strongly alkaline solution, especially of potassium hydroxide, used for washing or cleansing.

Last week, I heard the word about a pre-Halloweekend “White Lye” frat party. Not sure why the theme was a cleaning substance, but I didn’t really care — I’m an insufferable freshman desperate to get into any func.

On Saturday, my jolly ass hopped off the T and up the doorstep to Kappa Alpha Xbox Chi, looking forward to the night ahead of me. I entered and immediately scanned the room. My gaze stopped and I stalled. Fine shyt at the func?!

Fine shyt

at the

func.

Her shirt read “I’M GAY” in scrappy, sharpie-written letters. Perfect. She couldn’t have made it more obvious!

I’m going to approach.

Approaching.

Approached.

“Hey girl,” I mumbled. Not a hesitant mumble — a suggestive mumble, a self-assured mumble. “Is your refrigerator running?” That line always works.

“...What?”

“Well, you better go catch it! Soooo you're gay right? That’s so cool! Are you single orrrrr?”

She laughed. Hard. Presumably at my refrigerator joke, of course. God I’m so charismatic. She didn’t comment on the single part, so I assumed she didn't hear me.

I’m going to ask again.

Asking.

Asked.

“...Are you single orrrrr?”

She started drifting away, I think. I was becoming increasingly faded from the vodka lye. She was looking further and further, but it was probably just a drunken depth perception thing.

“Ummm, yeah?”

Let’s go. She’s gay AND single? And she thinks I'm hilarious (see joke above)? This is my opportunity.

“Well, I think you're beautiful. Uhmmm… do you have a phone number?”

She looked at me like I had three heads. “White LYE. It’s a white LYE party.”

Duhhhh, yeah I KNOW. The suspiciously white jungle juice, its white lye, obviiiiii. At this point, she was looking like a mere speck in a crowd of partygoers. It appeared as if there was 15 feet of distance between us, but I trusted that it was just the lye that had me fucked upppppppp! The rest of the night is an incredibly blurry memory for me, and I cannot recall how the conversation ended. But, rest assured, I woke up the following morning (3PM) to see that she had typed her number in my notes app!

“New Note

October 25, 2025 at 11:49 PM

(123) 456-78😀9”

I texted (123) 456-78😀9, but am still waiting for a response. She’s probably method acting for her ghost costume — lesbians love doing the most for Halloween. Y’all think she wants me?

articles.title: Sus and the City: Acting Strangely at Parties is IN
articles.description: This semester I've become something of a Carrie Bradshaw. Well, that's a stretch.
articles.content:
This semester I’ve become something of a Carrie Bradshaw. Well, that’s a stretch. I’m more like Scary Bradshaw, because shit’s getting seriously fucked.

Recently I’ve become an expert at Taking It Too Far. Have you ever seen a 5’3” girl slam a Cutwater, Smirnoff Ice Smash, and a 4Loko in the span of a few hours? Well, that’s my dark and twisted reality.

At parties, I can be found either a) dancing crazy, b) trying to execute a drunkenly-formed bit, or c) brooding in the corner plotting my (early) escape. Seriously, the early escape is no joke. I will leave after ten minutes if it’s not suiting me.

Forget socializing with your friends and friends of friends and that hot guy in the corner. Just start fucking with them. Drag your friend around and start telling anyone who will listen that you guys actually met at circus camp. Bonus points if you can convincingly sell a circus skill.

If the party has a cup pong vibe going on, a classic is to rally a crowd to “teach them a drinking game,” making it up as you go, of course. The rules are entirely of your creation so you can rig whoever you want to win– yourself, fine shyt, etc.

Certain parties are suited for Sus Behavior, and certain aren’t. I personally don’t have the radar to know so I just have to keep doing me. Someday maybe I’ll remember how to act normal in public. In the meantime, does anyone have a stick-on mustache? I have plans on Friday.

I experienced the wretched reality that is the summer after freshman year of college and something changed fundamentally. Spending enough time in a basement apartment infested with spiders will do that to you… but that’s a story for another time.

Upon returning to campus, I found myself an expert in the art of Taking It Too Far.

. But instead of becoming chiller and sexier, I turned into a professional at Taking It Too Far.
articles.name: Lauren Matz

articles.title: My Straight Man Friend Is Making a Suspicious Amount of Jokes About Fucking His Roommates
articles.description: INCIDENT REPORT #26 Incident type: Suspicious comment Date: October 14, 2025 Time: 22:58:03 Location: [REDACTED], Allston, MA 02134 Incident description: At approximately 11:00 PM last Tuesday, while perched on the couch of a friend's apartment, I overheard an exchange between two occupants of the household: INTERLOCUTOR 1*: I feel like shit. I've been out[side of the home] since 8:00 AM today.
articles.content:
INCIDENT REPORT #26

Incident type: Suspicious comment

Date: October 14, 2025

Time: 22:58:03

Location: [REDACTED], Allston, MA 02134

Incident description:

At approximately 11:00 PM last Tuesday, while perched on the couch of a friend’s apartment, I overheard an exchange between two occupants of the household:

INTERLOCUTOR 1*: I feel like shit. I’ve been out[side of the home] since 8:00 AM today.

INTERLOCUTOR 2**: [suggestive] I know something that would make you feel better.

INTERLOCUTOR 1: I don’t think your girlfriend would be very happy with that.

INTERLOCUTOR 2: She doesn’t have to know …

*homosexual

**heterosexual

I find it relevant to denote sexuality in this instance, as it highlights the anomalous nature of [INTERLOCUTOR 2]’s statements.

Although peculiar, this comment could be dismissed as an isolated incident if it didn’t fit into a very alarming pattern I’ve been observing over the past couple of months. As “The Boys” become increasingly comfortable with their domestic situation and accordingly spend more time together, it seems that these types of exchanges become more and more frequent.

In particular, [INTERLOCUTOR 2] spearheads this initiative, making suggestive jokes about his 3 roommates at disproportionate rates compared to if comments were equally dispersed among all occupants (ANOVA, p < 0.01). Similar jests have been made about more explicit subjects, such as “handies,” “suckjobs,” “butt stuff,” and once, memorably, “docking” (see INCIDENT REPORTS 3, 6, 7, and 19, respectively).

Anecdotally, I have also noticed that his comments become more vulgar on Monday, Thursday, and Sunday nights, perhaps indicating that the social aspect of watching football together buffers the unease of making homoerotic comments to roommates and friends, or that, under the guise of hegemonic masculinity performed through watching football, [INTERLOCUTOR 2] becomes more comfortable playing with the boundaries of his heterosexuality.

To be frank, dear reader, I am reaching my wit’s end. I can no longer tell what is real under this veil of post-meta-irony. Did my friends do it gay and nasty on the very couch I often find myself sitting on? Do I have a moral obligation to send a “hey girlie” text with virtually no evidence? I sometimes wonder if taking my speculations to an anonymous fiction-publishing platform would alleviate this insurmountable psychological burden, but for now, I will continue gathering data, and stay tormented in silence.

articles.title: Introducing The Mormon Missionaries To Pumpkin Spice Lattes To Forever Change The Trajectory Of Their Lives
articles.description: Disclaimer: I love Mormons! I think the Church of Latter Day Saints is positively nifty.
articles.content:
Disclaimer: I love Mormons!  I think the Church of Latter Day Saints is positively nifty.  That being said, the following article may come across as disrespectful, extremely offensive, or even blasphemy, to which I answer: He who is without sin among you, let him cast the first stone. (John 8:7-11)

In short: it’s not my problem that your religion is so funny.

When I first came across young missionaries John Smith and Jack Smythe, they were good Mormon boys who had lived every day of their lives according to the gospel of Joseph Smith (or the prophets via Joseph Smith?  Sorry, I was zoning out when they were giving me their long ass spiel.).  But although John and Jack had dedicated themselves to introducing the heathens of this earth to God’s plan, God didn’t plan on one thing: me.

I, Emma Santos, professional sinner, apostate, disruptor of Christly ways, and blasphemer (but only every other Tuesday), was stopped by eighteen-year-old, fresh-out-of-Seminary Smith and Smythe on my way down Comm Ave last weekend when they asked me a question no one has ever dared to ask in this world before: “Do you have a moment to talk about our lord and savior Jesus Christ?”

This was their first mistake.  For in approaching me, they invited the devil in.

“Indeed I do,” I replied.  “But do you have a moment to talk about my lord and savior, the pumpkin spice latte?”

They were hesitant, at first.  After all, caffeine consumption is not the practice of a good Mormon.  But I assured them that they can’t be truly holy unless they have known temptation first.  My gospel of bullshit was enough to convince them to follow me down the path of autumn-flavored sin.

The Warren Starbucks was kind enough to reserve a table for my anti-missionary mission.

With one sip, Jack slammed his cup down on the table, tore his tie from his neck, and ripped open his collared shirt hulk-style.

“I can see everything!” he cried.

John, who had not yet touched his pumpkin spice latte, was mortified.  “Jack, your garments are exposed.”

“I don’t care! I’m never wearing these ridiculous long underwear again!”

“You’re not speaking in Godly words, Jack.”

“I AM GOD!”  He grabbed John’s cup, forced his head back, and poured the entire pumpkin spice latte down his throat.

After he had been rather aggressively pumpkin spiced, John’s face became stricken with a look of alarm, then, of contemplation, and finally, of wonder.  He calmly turned towards me, placed his hands folded on the table, and said, “I would like another.”

And with that, they were forever converted from the Church of LDS to the Church of PSL.

We spent the rest of the afternoon gallivanting around the city, where I introduced them to the host of sinful pleasures they could now indulge in as a result of their conversion—like eating dessert before dinner and Eiffel Towering a stranger on Grindr.  They were particularly taken with the discovery of pumpkin spice vodka.  It was only after John pushed the go-go dancer at the club off the platform and the two of them started tangoing in his place that I began to question whether or not I should have let them have that twelfth shot of the stuff.

John and Jack have flown out from under my horns now, but we still keep in touch.  They’ve informed me that, next week, they intend on trying one curse word, three puffs from a joint, and, as an alternative to their missionary positions, they’ll be exploring doggy-style, reverse cowboy and Brigham Hung? (I don’t even know what that one is…)
articles.name: Emma Santos

articles.title: Notes of a Waterbottle in the Cuck Chair: Watching my Cuckqueen Down 3 Cold Brews, 2 Celsius, and a Fireball Shooter in the Mugar Stacks
articles.description: Life looks slightly different from the cuck chair. The slant of the light peaking over the Law building; the buzzing of the fluorescent lights overhead; the heavy breathing of your lover chugging on another bottle's nozzle—the little things that wouldn't excite me if I otherwise was not sitting in Mugar's 6th floor cuck chair, watching my cuckqueen run a train on 3 cold brews, 2 celsius, and a fireball shooter.
articles.content:
Life looks slightly different from the cuck chair. The slant of the light peaking over the Law building; the buzzing of the fluorescent lights overhead; the heavy breathing of your lover chugging on another bottle’s nozzle—the little things that wouldn't excite me if I otherwise was not sitting in Mugar’s 6th floor cuck chair, watching my cuckqueen run a train on 3 cold brews, 2 celsius, and a fireball shooter. And boy, do they excite me.

My name is Owala. I don’t know how I became this way. People think love is all fairy-tales and romance, that exclusivity is the end goal. But what’s truly made to not be broken? and what is sex if not broken taboos?

Everytime my cuckqueen arises from that stiff wooden throne in search for another bull, I sit there with anticipation wondering if she’ll finally choose me. But it’s never me, me with my wittol delusions. Who is it, you wonder? Yerba. A gay ass Olipop. Then Iced Americano with Non-Dairy Cold Foam Creamer. And if she’s really hungry that day, maybe even Tajin Mangoes from that one lady off of CommAve.

It’s okay to admit you think I’m perverse. I wouldn’t say so. There’s an elite status in sitting in the cuck chair. Only one drink can sit here while any drink can be drunk. Only one liquid has been here the whole time, all 22 oz of this sweet Brita-filtered water just waiting for my cuckqueen under this rubber-lined lid and buckle. She makes glances in my direction every so often, the ultimate tease. When she does, condensation perspirates down my stainless steel exterior, pooling all over the vandalized library desktops.

There’s also something so righteous about the cuck chair. She knows deep down inside that I’m truly the only drink capable of quenching her primal thirst. It’s why she keeps me around. At the end of the day, she’s the one who doesn’t really get a say in this dynamic. She may own me—she may cuck me—but ultimately, she drinketh from me. And fuck, is my cup running overfloweth.

articles.title: What Do You Mean I’m Not the Only Gay Person? How Moving to Boston Made Me Homophobic
articles.description: BU orientation: I remember it as clear as day. I geared up with my corduroy shorts, grown out wolfcut, and of course, my freshly pierced septum.
articles.content:
BU orientation: I remember it as clear as day. I geared up with my corduroy shorts, grown out wolfcut, and of course, my freshly pierced septum. Freshman year me was ready to fight the hoards of people swarming to meet the most niche, mysterious, unique, and cool person they had ever seen (me).

Back in Texas, I was the token queer. My gayness mogged everyone wherever I went. I felt like Moses in my flannel and chains, parting the red sea of Lululemon skirts and Altar’d State tops. People I had never talked to in my life would tell me about their bi-curious experiences like I was their gay therapist. I barely know you but I’m so glad that you want to eat box! Having short hair, dressing alternatively, being the GSA president, and my devotion to theatre put me at first place for gayest gay in school without even trying. Sure the casual homophobia and judgement kind of sucked, but at least I was original…… or so I thought.

I walk into the GSU, ready for my new life.

What the fuck…..?

This place felt like a PRIDE PARADE. Dyed hair to my left, facial piercings on my right, mullets, twinks, lesbians… Never in my LIFE had I seen so many queers in one place.

The same septum that made it feel like I had “GAY” written on my forehead in Texas, completely blended in with everyone else in Boston. I went from being the killer whale, to just a gay little goldfish. What do you mean I’m just like everyone else? Nobody cares that I’m gay?

Still processing my shock, I move up to the check-in table to get my nametag. “Welcome! Please write down your name and pronouns,” they tell me. “Pronouns?” I scoff. They can’t be serious. What kind of place is this? Gayville? You mean people won’t stumble over their words, wondering what to call me? I won’t be pulled aside after class because a teacher heard I go by different pronouns? I’ll just be treated like……. everyone else????

You know what? Maybe the Texans were right about this. The gay agenda is spreading like wildfire. The indoctrination has gone too far. I feel like I can’t catch a break from wokeness everywhere. You know I’m all for acceptance and everything but I have my limits. This has gone too far. Please, for my own wellbeing, just stop shoving it in my face.
articles.name: Alex Peplinski

articles.title: I Climbed Out Of My Head: Why Gabbie Hannah Deserves Poet Laureate
articles.description: Aristotle once said, "We are what we repeatedly do; excellence then is not an act, but a habit," and who has been more representative of this wisdom than the prolific Gabbie Hanna: Author, prophet, poet, musical.ly icon, and Teen Choice Award Nominee. This author would like to formally nominate Gabbie Hanna for one of our nation's most cherished positions within the Library of Congress: The United States Poet Laureate.
articles.content:
Aristotle once said, “We are what we repeatedly do; excellence then is not an act, but a habit,” and who has been more representative of this wisdom than the prolific Gabbie Hanna: Author, prophet, poet, musical.ly icon, and Teen Choice Award Nominee. This author would like to formally nominate Gabbie Hanna for one of our nation’s most cherished positions within the Library of Congress: The United States Poet Laureate. Most known for her most famous, and this author’s favourite spoken word poem:

“God, I wish I could sleep.

God. I. wish. I. could. Sleep.

But I can’t today, cause theres babies dying on the fucking street.

I saw two homeless babies adopting eachother on the fucking street.

Wake the fuck up before we go to sleep. Wake the fuck up, theres babies on the street.”

Actually generational. Name a more influential piece of literature in the last ten years. Crickets.

And of course, we can’t mention Gabbie Hanna without discussing one of her first works, the iconic monologue: “I climbed out of my head and watched myself implode, a thought without a body ought to be the shot to take a load off my brain is poison and im searching for the antidote but everytime I find it my defences scream oh-no-he-don’t…”

woah

Chills. Actual chills.

Of course, she will have to beat out the favored nominee, Tessa Brooks, former member of Team10 who famously had the competition shook as well as a self-proclaimed teacher, saying “Let me educate ya, and I ain’t talking book, Panera is your home, so stop calling my phone. I fly like a drone, they buyin’ like a loan. Yeah, I smell good. Is that your boy’s cologne?”

Now you may be like, “Author, how is Tessa Brooks likely to be the next poet laureate if she hasn’t come out with another hit since 2017?” To that I say, have you listened to It's Everyday Bro recently? It went Platinum in the U.S for a reason, her talent speaks for itself and I won’t dignify that question with any further response.

Now, who do I think will come out supreme in this match-up of literary greats? Well, fair reader, only one of these women wrote the life-changing, actually published poem titled Relative where she says: "Time is relative, beauty is relative, family is relatives.” like damn. What other proof do you want? What more does she have to give? Jesus. Just give her the damn title.

Some of her critics call her writing shallow or meaningless, but to that I say: when's the last time you took a risk? Put yourself out there? When's the last time you wrote a poem, hmm? I bet it was some “real eyes, realize, real lies” bullshit from when you were 13. I bet you found that composition bound notebook deep inside your closet a few years back and were too afraid to open it and look at the pages. Too afraid to read them, too embarrassed of yourself to even throw it away. You’re a coward.

You could never be her. Give her what she deserves, and the Nobel Peace Prize too. No one understands you like I do, Gabbie.
articles.name: Ellie Tiwari

articles.title: Police Response to Campus Protests is “A Little Fake and Gay”, Says Candace Owens
articles.description: 2025 has been a weird year for free speech, and more importantly, me. I defended Jimmy Kimmel for the first time in my life.
articles.content:
2025 has been a weird year for free speech, and more importantly, me. I defended Jimmy Kimmel for the first time in my life. My most recent YikYak post got so many downvotes, it was removed it from the platform, which I would classify as silencing a young broke queer BIPOC voice (GoFundMe linked below). And I found myself agreeing with the one person I never thought I could share an opinion with: Candace Owens.

Candace (are we on a first-name basis because we agree on this? idk) has taken a second between her investigation of former gay best friend Charlie Kirk’s assassination and transvestigation of the First Lady of France to comment on the Quinobequin Student Front for Palestine’s recent protest at the GSU, calling the police response “a little fake and gay”. She says that there were more red and blue lights on Comm Ave that day than at the MAGA Fashion Show on Long Island last year, which is still under review.

I’ve been processing what it really means to agree with the woman who says she is somewhere between a flat-earther and a round-earther. Are my woke-lib sensibilities also fake and gay? Or do we all just have a little Candace in us? That one is a chilling thought. Lest we forget that Candace herself also used to lib the fuck out. In addition to being a Tumblr-era girlblogger who investigated Trump’s dick size (which she concluded was “very small”), Candace was once an intern at Vogue. I guess the devil really does wear Prada.

Also in recent news, BU has received an “F” in recent university free speech surveys for the fifth time in a row. It’s probably because nobody fucked with my attempt at elevator banter this morning (again, silencing young broke queer BIPOC voices GoFundMe linked below!!!!). Directly afterward, I was asked if I thought I was good enough to get into Heaven outside of Marsh Plaza on my post-elevator walk of shame. Clearly, the people in the elevator and the white dude in cargo shorts whose pamphlet I refused think I should rot in hell. Candace is conspiring that the “F” for free speech actually stands for “Fakeandgay”. Fuck, she might be onto something again.

President Gilliam has also weighed in on the free speech crisis that is affecting so many BU students but mostly me. In a statement released last Thursday, she states. “Discourse and democracy are some of the key pillars of student life here at Boston University. For that reason, we are proud to announce the Free and Good Zone (FAGZ) in the basement of the Howard Thurman Center for Good, where students can exercise their First amendment rights in a soundproof chamber designed specifically for amplifying student voices. Students can rent out the space from the hours of 1am-5am after Venmoing me a $20 fee to support our ongoing mulch restoration project.”

If you read this far and were expecting the GoFundMe link to be there at the end, the administration wiped it from the Internet and stole my funds for–you guessed it–the mulch restoration project. My life sucks.

articles.title: Busking by Hitting the Woah Really Well in Kenmore Station
articles.description: EXT. KENMORE STATION - MIDDAY CUT TO: INT.
articles.content:
EXT. KENMORE STATION - MIDDAY

CUT TO:

INT. KENMORE STATION

PAIGE (20) strides in, briefcase in hand, wearing a fedora, sunglasses, and white gloves.

She glides down the stairs and slips behind a commuter paying for their ticket, deftly evading the fare.

Another flight down. The train tracks are in front of her. She sets her briefcase down.

The station hums faintly.

With gentle precision, she unlocks the case.

It appears empty.

PAIGE

(clears throat)

Eh-hmm.

She reaches in with her right hand and pulls out... nothing? No, it’s something.

The so-called “woah.”

Her right hand rises. Slowly, deliberate.

Ohhhhhhh

PAIGE (CONT’D)

She launches the woah into the sky, right arm in the air. Her eyes follow up and don’t look back down.

EXT. KENMORE STATION - AFTERNOON

Pedestrians drift by.

INT. KENMORE STATION

Paige still stands, waiting to catch her woah.

EXT. KENMORE STATION - NIGHT

Dead quiet on the Boston streets.

2.

INT. KENMORE STATION

Same spot. Same stare. Still no woah.

EXT. KENMORE STATION - DAWN

Birds chirp.

INT. KENMORE STATION

Paige hasn’t budged, staring at the ceiling. Woah must be miles above her.

EXT. KENMORE STATION - DAY

It’s been twenty four hours at this point.

INT. KENMORE STATION

With a twitch. Paige’s arms finally start to move. She braces, poised.

Ohhh!

PAIGE

She catches the woah. Absolutely hits that shit. Nailed it. No applause. No witnesses.

She tucks the woah back into the briefcase, clicks it shut, and climbs the stairs.

Tomorrow, she’ll try again.
articles.name: Paige Schwartz

articles.title: Being the Middle Child Isn’t So Bad, Says Number Sixty-Eight
articles.description: There is extensive research about the kind of person that you are, depending on when you were chronologically born. It's scientifically proven and 100% factual.
articles.content:
There is extensive research about the kind of person that you are, depending on when you were chronologically born. It’s scientifically proven and 100% factual. If you’re the oldest daughter, you’re burnt out and you make it everybody’s problem. If you’re an only child, you’re selfish, nosy, and probably a wielder of weaponized incompetence. Despite this, the middle child is what concerns us. Abandoned. Misguided. Forgotten. What even goes on with you guys? Who are you, really? All questions parents have asked middle children before, when they come to the dinner table. Well, we’ll find out the answers together – We had the privilege of hosting an interview with distinguished Mr. Sixty-Eight.

Interviewer: “So what was your family situation like growing up?”

68: “When I was little, I spent many nights crying in my room alone, wishing—praying—that my parents would finally show me some love, just like they do for my brothers. Being valued less than Meg from Family Guy was, at the very least, a humbling experience.”

Interviewer: “Interesting. What are your brothers like, then?”

68: “Well. My younger brother, 67, is always joking around and smiling. Some bisexual girls might call him a ‘golden retriever boyfriend.’ I don’t see it. He’s projected to develop popcorn lung by eighteen because he can’t put down his yart. Every time he laughs, it sounds like a gunshot.”

Interviewer: “And your older brother?”

68: “To be honest, I barely even see the guy because he’s never even home. He always spends his nights at the homes of random Grindr hookups. Not to slutshame in the great year of 2025, but he’s a man so it’s okay. I think he tried every single position by the time I learned to walk. He would probably crack a teapot if its spout was long enough. I think he’s willing to try women, as long as Superman 2025 is in the bedroom too. One day he’s going to sleep with a Jeffrey Dahmer, and none of us would even realize until it’s too late.”

Interviewer: “So who do you like more?”

68: “It’s like picking between Conrad and Jeremiah – both are bad choices, just one is bisexual, and you would rather watch Belly selfcest.” 

Interviewer: “Ah… yes. I see. But what do you think now about being the middle child?”

68: “Honestly, I see now that it’s really not so bad. I mean, I’m never in the spotlight, which I don’t hate, and yet I can still reap their rewards. My older brother’s been a famous porn star for years now, which is good for him because he’s always got money coming in from elderly sponsors. A portion of that money ends up in my wallet. And my younger brother just recently got famous from that one Tiktok, and I can ride off his clout. So yeah, I actually got a pretty good gig going on.”
articles.name: Vie Sun

articles.title: This Is So Freudian! And Other Things I Say To Justify My Nicotine Addiction.
articles.description: I don't even like them that much! I could quit anytime!
articles.content:
I don't even like them that much! I could quit anytime! I only smoke a pack a week!

All of these phrases have been uttered by me and my fellow smokers for centuries, attempting to rationalize why we continue to put tar straight into our lungs. The answer most of the time, is nothing reasonable, mainly that I look cool and my lexapro no longer works so I have nothing to regulate my nervous system.

Sometimes the oral fixation of putting something into my mouth, the beautiful intake of 92 carcinogens and the sweet release brings me a comfort only Freud could understand. My mom was also a smoker, I wonder what he would think of that.

But I look so cool! They make my films 2.3x more profound!

Smoking on COM lawn at 2pm is aura? Right? I’m a film major, what else am I supposed to do besides be a degenerate and debate Paul Thomas Anderson new film?

Half of the connections in the film industry are made on smoke breaks, a new Deadline report says. Look, at least every cool artist has a photo where they smoke a cig, it stimulates the brain!

What else am I supposed to do with my hands? Where should I place my lips? Is this working? Those aren't things I say during sex, those are words that I say to “you should quit while you're ahead!”. Fuck you. Let them live in a non-binary world.

Overall, I think it’s okay to have a nicotine addiction if you’re cool.

articles.title: Beautiful Wonderful Fairy Angel With Pure Heart And Golden Soul Does Not Concern Themselves With Whether They Look High Right Now
articles.description: Around nine on Thursday, I awoke from my peaceful slumber and climbed out of my gleaming chrysalis after a long night of communing with trees through my dreams.
articles.content:
Beautiful Wonderful Fairy Angel With Pure Heart And Golden Soul Does Not Concern Themselves With Whether They Look High Right Now

Around nine on Thursday, I awoke from my peaceful slumber and climbed out of my gleaming chrysalis after a long night of communing with trees through my dreams. The sunlight streaming in through the windows was particularly bright on my naturally dewy, glowing face, warming my rosy cheeks.

I wouldn’t have class until later in the afternoon, so I decided to begin my morning with a fresh bowl, not of cereal, but a breakfast of champions known to many as the Wake and Bake ritual. I packed a sticky bowl of some strain called Alien Taint and cracked open my energy drink.

I checked my phone, because I’m addicted to the ragebait on my Twitter (yes, I deadname her) timeline. Huh. That’s strange, there’s a private GroupMe message from my RA. They want to see me downstairs? A surge of anxiety rushed through my petite frame. I effortlessly threw my hair into a messy bun, tucked my feet into my Ugg slippers, and finished smoking my bowl before heading out.

On the first floor, I’m greeted with… oh my god, is that… iconic boy band One Direction? No, wait, my vision focused, and it’s just the gay boys that live in the basement apartment-style dorm. I held the door for them – two say thanks, one is busy listening to Snow Strippers (totally get it), and one looked me up and down with an unreadable facial expression. I’m too autistic for all that, so I chose to disregard it and continued towards the end of the hall where my RA waited for me with an odd-looking man. He was dressed in green robes that seemed to glisten in the hazy light emanating from the boob-like ceiling lamp above us.

“Hey, so, hate to be the bearer of bad news, but your department head had to sell you to the fairy kingdom since they got all their federal research funding cut. They’re like, super sorry, but you actually signed a document agreeing to this earlier in the semester,” my RA says, forcing a smile through it all. God fucking dammit. This was just my luck! Here I was, a senior about to finish my degree, high as shit, still in my jammies, being sold to the fucking fairy kingdom.

“Oh, there’s no need to worry, my dear!” the man in green exclaimed. I fixed my face, realizing I had definitely been making one. “I promise you’ll feel just dandy once you get settled. Haven’t you always felt… a bit different? From your peers? More attuned to the voices of the voiceless, able to recognize the underlying patterns in nature that this glorious earth wants you to see. My guess is that some would probably describe you as a manic pixie dream girl?”

“I’m nonbinary, hoe.”

He waved his hands around apologetically. “Right, right. But I’m close on all the other stuff?”

“Prolly,” I shrugged.

“Hold on.” He leaned in, staring intently at my eyes. I could really see how old he was up close, and his wrinkles shone beneath the boob light. It was weird as fuck, but with the morning I’d been having, I didn’t really care. “Are you… high?” he asked.

I could feel my body start tweaking before it hit my brain. I’m gonna be in so much trouble. I tried to speak, but my cotton mouth was so bad that I got too embarrassed and started shaking my head but ended up nodding instead.

“MARVELOUS!” he exclaimed, jumping up and down and clapping excitedly. What the fuck? “You’re exactly as the prophecy foretold!”

Oh my god bruh. My terror transformed into confusion (but also quite a bit of relief).

“We have been searching for you! You are the one they have written of in the ancient tomes. We are a centuries-old people, and we have long-possessed and harnessed the powers of the plant you are so fond of.”

Whatever I smoked had to be laced or something. That’s the only possible explanation. “That’s lit and all… but like… what do you want from me?”

“We need someone who is willing to sit on this bed of moss, watch Youtube, and smoke our weed all day,”

“Wait yeah 😭I’m so down as long as y’all have Family Guy clips,” I said. We might be nearing the end times, so I might as well enjoy myself.

“How the fuck did you just say that emoji?” he asked, but I just stared at him blankly. I was occupied thinking about the plane crash analysis videos I’d get to watch fried. He shook his head. “Never mind. This is great news, and of course we do. It’s all been prepared for years, it was foretold.”

He escorted me outside to a dragonfly-drawn carriage, with Charli XCX softly emanating from the interior. Multiple bikers yelled at it to get out of the bike lane.

“I’ve had the sprites pack up your things. They were actually really impressed with your collection of ironic shirts and the books that you swear you’re going to read this semester.”

“You don’t have to keep glazing me, I’m already sold.”

“Perfect. Now, let’s go to 7/11. You could go for something, right?”

A tear of joy slid down my cheek. “Yeah. Yeah, I could.”
articles.name: Ces Lodovico

articles.title: First I LOLed, Then I Serioused: Being God’s Number One Giggler in These Trying Times
articles.description: We are living in a dark age for comedy and NOBODY wants to address it. Sure, everything is awfully dire, but as far as I know, it is STILL LEGAL TO LAUGH.
articles.content:
We are living in a dark age for comedy and NOBODY wants to address it. Sure, everything is awfully dire, but as far as I know, it is STILL LEGAL TO LAUGH. For now, at least.

Besides the serious implications of taking several late-night comedians off the air, a girl has to wonder… why are they only coming for the gigglers? Surely there are some real stoic, unfunny types that like to criticize the government too. But allllll the funny people are getting knocked down like sitting ducks. Just saying, I can think of a few people who hate Trump that aren’t comedians… come for Gracie Abrams instead I MEAN– Who said that?

Anyways, even my own peers are losing their ability to laugh. The other day in my screenwriting class I pitched a comedy and was met with nothing but blank stares. I was shocked– when I showed the pitch to my fellow LOLers it was a hoot and a half! Are we living in a world where a simple COMEDY is a hard sell???

“What if you turned the opening scene into a horror?” one of my classmates asked. Another chimed in: “I think you should focus more on the disappointment your character feels towards her roommate.” Of course, I took every suggestion with grace. But would it be so absurd to just keep a comedy a comedy? Surely they will come to appreciate getting to chuckle a little bit during table reads when every other script is about someone’s dead grandma.

If you’re reading this article, you clearly have some appreciation for the magic and whimsy of laughter. So, dear reader, let me make it known that it is in fact this particular giggler’s birthday today. If you’re feeling so inclined to celebrate it, I compel you to go and spread the giggle gospel as much as you can– it is clearly a dying art. As the 1952 film Singin’ in the Rain says, make ‘em laugh! Go hoot and holler with your friends! Slip on a banana peel in the dining hall! Maybe repost a meme or two to your close friends story (or main if you dare.) You know what they say: If you can’t beat them, make jokes about them… or something along those lines. Giggler GoFundMe linked in my bio xoxo.
articles.name: Lauren Matz

articles.title: New Animal Drop: Gay Giraffes
articles.description: Description
articles.content:
This week, Scientists unveiled the newest addition to the Animal Kingdom: Gay(y)  Giraffes. This new, entirely different species was recently discovered wandering the streets of San Francisco holding a water bottle absolutely DECKED OUT with stickers and at least 4 carabiners attached to it.

Mark Penis, director of the Zoology Research Center in California stated: “These things have been being spotted more frequently over the last few days, mostly in night clubs or at Clairo concerts.”

The Gay(y) Giraffe is yet another animal added in a long line of homosexual beasts. Other recent discoveries have included: Pan Penguins, Bi Baboons and Gay Ass Ostrich. In accordance with these discoveries, Zoos all around the globe have added a pride exhibit, though many people have confused these exhibits with lions and been thoroughly disappointed.

One Zoo-goer, Daniel Clitoris stated “Like there’s nothing wrong with being gay, I’m just genuinely confused about why there’s separate exhibits for what are clearly normal animals.”

In association with other zoologists who fund our paper, we at the Pinky Toe will go on record to say that Daniel Clitoris is a fake bitch who cannot be trusted in any way, shape, or form.
articles.name: New Animal Drop: Gay Giraffes

articles.title: The DL Trade Winds Are Coming and They Might Scoop Up My Friend Jessica
articles.description: I have this friend. We'll call her Jessica.
articles.content:
I have this friend. We’ll call her Jessica. She is so obviously gay, but she won’t admit it to me. She acts really interested whenever I mention anything about how I’m gay, as if this is a new perspective she hadn’t considered before. One time, I even heard her call a man cute (It was really quickly, in passing one time. She yelled it to him on the street. Now that I think about it, she may have said “I like your boots”).

My gay friends (I collect them by the pound) have all asked me about her, wondering which way she swings. I always tell them the same thing: that she never said anything about it, but I believed in the deep dark pits of my soul that she was gay and messing with me. I mean, it’s constant. Her hair, her voice, her clothes, her posture, it all points to one answer, right? And women flock to her like there’s no tomorrow. I watch how she behaves, and she always lightly denies them without saying anything about how she's not interested or taken. Just that she’s “not looking for any trouble tonight,” ????????? well what the hell does that mean!

All of this to say, when I heard about how the DL trade winds were coming, I was getting scared. What do you mean the supergaystorm would finally get an answer to the Jessica situation before I did? Not to mention, what if Jessica never got to live her true gay self because the DL trade winds were going to whisk her away!!!

For those confused, let's back things up a bit. Some people are familiar with the trade winds, which are winds that blow from the east to the west from 30 degrees north to 30 degrees west. The DL trade winds are similar, a collection of winds that blow around the world, scooping up all the DL gay people each year to relocate them in the hopes that they can find themselves somewhere else. If this sounds like you, it means not all hope is lost!!!! But back to Jessica.

I am afraid. Jessica if you’re reading this please don’t be afraid to be who you are and I will accept you and don’t let the DL trade winds get you because we have that group presentation Wednesday and you lowkey still owe me $15 and I really enjoy being your friend and maybe when this is all over I can buy you a frozen yogurt and we can clear this up okay???? Wear lots of layers this weekend. Eat a cheeseburger. If it starts feeling breezy out, head to the nearest GSA community center and STAY PUT. I am already on my way. Kisses and I’ll be waiting.

B
articles.name: The DL Trade Winds Are Coming and They Might Scoop Up My Friend Jessica

articles.title: BuzzFeed Reports: So Far, Only Eugene From Try Guys Tried Guys
articles.description: Sunday, September 4th – A recent report from BuzzFeed News, 4 time winner of the "Yes, We ARE a News Source" Award, reported that a whistle blower from the Try Guys corporation confirms that Eugene Lee Yang is the only member of the Try Guys who truly tried men. This casts doubt on the entire entertainment group including human-beanpole Keith Habersberg, and lactose intolerant gremlin Zach Kornfeld.
articles.content:
Sunday, September 4th – A recent report from BuzzFeed News, 4 time winner of the “Yes, We ARE a News Source” Award, reported that a whistle blower from the Try Guys corporation confirms that Eugene Lee Yang is the only member of the Try Guys who truly tried men. This casts doubt on the entire entertainment group including human-beanpole Keith Habersberg, and lactose intolerant gremlin Zach Kornfeld. This scandal shocked many people, primarily those who have never seen Mr. Lee Yang’s outfits. The response from those familiar with Try Guys reacted to the report with a unanimous “What???!!!” Most couldn’t believe Zach and Keith weren’t secretly a thing. While the report is damning, BuzzFeed has drawn speculation as new evidence suggests the whistle blower was PLANTED by BuzzFeed itself, to take down the Try Guys and become relevant again.

The story began a couple years back, when Try Guys separated from BuzzFeed news. This was shocking, and no one saw this coming, especially considering that no one had ever left BuzzFeed. The Try Guys began their successful Youtube journey, as they invented a new genre of video “white people trying asian food mukbang.” Their virality continued, as they filmed themselves doing other domestic tasks, trying on clothes and baking different foods. Allegedly, this is when BuzzFeed decided to end their rise and expose them to win back popularity. According to new LAPD affidavits, BuzzFeed news found a gay UCLA journalism major doing poppers at a rave in Long Beach and hired him on the spot. Once they had acquired their double agent, they peer-pressured him with no effort to work as an assistant for the Try Guys, at which point he would try to seduce them and expose them. According to a leak from inside BuzzFeed, they even had an article and press release ready, called “Try Guys? More like Try Gays!” 

The smear campaign was ultimately unsuccessful for many reasons. Despite many attempts, the double agent was not able to seduce Zach Kornfeld because Zach was literally allergic to everything that the intern was wearing or eating. On lunch breaks, the intern attempted to make a move, but when Zach noticed he drank coffee with milk right before. Zach is deathly allergic to dairy, and immediately ran away crying while hurting all his joints and bones, as he has a strange skeletal condition.

The intern altered course, and eyed Keith as his next victim. Keith’s microplastic-filled, fast food-built tree-trunk of a body made him very attractive to the spy. However, his whorish advances ultimately fell short, because Keith was far too tall and large, considering the fact that he does a mukbang a week. . Keith’s towering height and spanning width made him about 10x larger than the meek college intern. When the intern tried to flirt, Keith thought he was an oddly shaped chicken nugget, and tried to eat him.

Defeated and scared of being outed, the intern tried his luck with Eugene, a durable enough and not massive person. Eugene, however, was the most intimidating, boasting an extremely sharp jawline and cheekbones that reflected blinding light into the eyes of anyone looking at him. The intern-spy pulled out all the stops: he poisoned Eugene’s coffee, he sprayed pheromones all over himself, he even loudly praised Eugene's film Comfort Girls (2024) at the office. This worked, and Eugene eventually opened up to the intern. “Listen you little slut, I don’t know your name, but I can tell you’re trying to out me as gay man so BuzzFeed can be relevant again. But guess what, diva? It won't werk. Cuz I’ve been out proudly for years. Did you not see my coming out dance video??? It has like 21M views!”

Hearing there was a new subordinate in town, Ned was eager to fuck the intern. He unfortunately got confused on who to cheat on his loving wife with and had sex with another employee, at which point he was kicked off the Try Guys. So yeah, that’s why that happened.
articles.name: BuzzFeed Reports: So Far, Only Eugene From Try Guys Tried Guys

articles.title: Belly, Conrad, Jeremiah, and Other Things I’d Name My Kid if I Hated Them
articles.description: This summer, the phenomenon that is The Summer I Turned Pretty season 3 has been taking over pop culture once again. If there's one thing our generation is gonna do, it's love a mediocre show with subpar acting and a questionable plotline because of two middling white love interests.
articles.content:
This summer, the phenomenon that is The Summer I Turned Pretty season 3 has been taking over pop culture once again. If there’s one thing our generation is gonna do, it’s love a mediocre show with subpar acting and a questionable plotline because of two middling white love interests. That being said, the worst part of it all is that the characters have terrible names, or nicknames, that I myself wouldn’t name my children unless I had a vendetta against them from their time in the womb. Before I get into the nitty-gritty of this list, I’d like to say that I’m sincerely sorry if your name appears on this list. Actually, scratch that. I’m just sincerely sorry for you.

  1. Belly
  • Now I’ll acknowledge that this is only a nickname, but out of all the options, I think we have to agree that this is the worst. With cards on the table, such as Izzy, Belle, Bella, Isa, and many others, why would we choose Belly? At that point, you might as well just call her stomach, or abdomen, or gut, or tummy. Not so flattering anymore, now is it?
  1. Conrad
  • Now this is not even a name in my humble opinion; it’s merely a smattering of consonants and vowels. My biggest fear is the day in the not-so-distant future when I meet the first little Conrad roaming around in the world. Also, Chris Briney, along with other actors, ruined the Mean Girls movie, so I harbor a deep-seated hatred for his mediocrity.
  1. Jeremiah
  • Jeremiah is the name of the kid who eats paste in the corner of the playground and manages to be unconsciously insufferable. A perfect name for the character, I will say, but that's no excuse for Jenny Han’s actions, causing me to see it everywhere.
  1. Honorable Mentions
  • Makayleigh: White people need to stop trying to be different; it makes my eyes hurt.
  • Anyone named Richard who goes by Dick: Are you gay or something?
  • Jerica: Could you not pick one?
  • Doyle: Do I even need to comment on this one?
  • McKinley: There’s only room for one McKinley in this world, and the High School from Glee took the spot
  • Lastly, any girl whose name is something followed by Rose. You’re not special, your name is Sarah.
articles.name: Belly, Conrad, Jeremiah, and Other Things I’d Name My Kid if I Hated Them

articles.title: Clairo-voyant: The Implications of A Performative Male Summer
articles.description: Clairo-voyant: The Implications of A Performative Male Summer By Willa Norvell A few months ago, an assembly of belligerent creatures zipped up their cocoons, festered in cells, and emerged as a new and improved species (or perhaps not so improved as we thought). The performative male (Matchalo Manipulativo) is a large boy of the genus Predatora, native to underground record stores and trendy cafes.
articles.content:
Clairo-voyant: The Implications of A Performative Male Summer

By Willa Norvell

A few months ago, an assembly of belligerent creatures zipped up their cocoons, festered in cells, and emerged as a new and improved species (or perhaps not so improved as we thought).

The performative male (Matchalo Manipulativo) is a large boy of the genus Predatora, native to underground record stores and trendy cafes. It has a pseudo-edgy appearance; loafer covered feet; headphone-bound ears; and a baseball cap protecting its empty skull. It is sexually dimorphic, often adorning Trader Joe’s tote bags and massive baggy pants, although the return of affection is far and few between.

As a zealous species, groups often gather in parks to participate in contests. A performative male contest consists of a large pride of these individuals who project “feminist-ideals” to their potential partners. Groups of female spectators usually huddle together during this ritual, giggling at the sight and posting on TikTok. The performative male believes itself to be an apex and keystone predator, although reality has shown this is far from the truth.

What does this new obsession mean for society? So much time, media space, and attention has blindly been dedicated to this cause. The lasting effects of such a cataclysmic event will be felt for months, if not years following its cessation. If the federal government feels uncomfortable to call it what it is, I will.

Firstly, it is a recession indicator. From Lana to Labubu, the fiscal consequences of this trend cannot be ignored. While an increase in matcha purchases from small businesses may have aided a handful of tiny stores, the overwhelming capitalistic return on keychains, mass produced self-help books, and pop vinyls cancels out any good.

Second, the demand for optometrists will skyrocket! Because the species attempted to cater to the “female gaze”, women all over the world are personally gauging their eyes out in the hopes that they will never have to confront the sight again. Invest in your glasses early folks, they may be out of stock soon.

Last but not least, the thrift stores across America are PICKED OVER. The worst part is that I will never look as cool wearing those big pants and cropped T as the guy who does not understand “Amoeba”.

Nevertheless, this era is coming to a close, and we must be ready to fight off the effects. Time to take back tea, save Sally Rooney, and clutch those carabiners close to our chests.
articles.name: Willa Norvell

articles.title: Group Projects Make Me Feel Like a Cop: A Prison Abolitionist’s Perspective
articles.description: Group Project Rant I am a principled man. A moral man.
articles.content:
I am a principled man. A moral man. A man who stands in the face of injustice in all of its various forms. I do all the good, neighborly things, like feeding stray cats and helping old ladies across the street. I like to think I am generally a pleasant person to be around.

This is why you should take my perspective in good faith when I tell you, nay, implore you, that we need to start being normal in group projects. Look. I understand that my needing a good GPA to apply to grad school is not the base case. I also understand that only receiving validation in its academic forms when I was younger has permanently soul-bonded me to being a tryhard forever. I am not happy about this. But if I keep incurring the costs of being the cop in the group project, I will blame YOU in my suicide note after the accumulated psychic damage drives me over the edge.

We are all adults here. So I don’t understand why I have to send three emails that say, “just following up on this …” in order for anyone to look at the Google Doc. I look soooo pathetic quintuple-texting the project group chat begging people to work on the slideshow. I haven’t done that since I drunkenly messaged my high school ex-situationship in a frat basement in my freshman year of college. Why are you making me relive that for an intro-level lecture class?

I believe strongly that the only way to achieve a just and moral world is to entirely dismantle the justice system in its current forms, so you can imagine the extreme cognitive dissonance I’m experiencing cuts me to my core. I’ve been reduced to an arm of the oppressive state (200-level class), upholding the status quo through rigid enforcement (scheduling meetings and splitting up work), and doling out vicious, disproportionate punitive measures for any disruptions to the system (writing negative group member evals sometimes). The authoritarian role I adopt goes against everything that I stand for, making me an abhorrent, sickening hypocrite. I’ve AC’d my last AB. I’ve 13’d my last 12. And finally, I’ve become the bastard. What a cruel twist of fate.

It’s also, like, I just know I’m being saddled with this responsibility because I’m Asian. And also a woman (well like not really at all but it’s complicated). I’m an Asian woman (kind of) and you want me to be your secretary and your calculator and your calendar and your reminders app and your science-fiction android and you hate me so bad!!! Why else would you make me police the progress and quality of our project? The spirit of a group project lies in collective responsibility and community collaboration, and I am now the representative of state oppression in the form of a Chinese they-cop. What the hell? The karmic debt I’m incurring will never leave me and I’m going to hell now. And it’s all your fault.
articles.name: Group Projects Make Me Feel Like a Cop: A Prison Abolitionist’s Perspective

articles.title: White Women Sure Love Showing You Their Sensible Shoes
articles.description: This just in: The second most comfortable group of people in society has found a way to make themselves even more comfortable. Gone are the days of sky-high stiletto pumps that gave Lindsay from Omaha her chance to feel like Ke$ha for just one wild night.
articles.content:
This just in: The second most comfortable group of people in society has found a way to make themselves even more comfortable.

Gone are the days of sky-high stiletto pumps that gave Lindsay from Omaha her chance to feel like Ke$ha for just one wild night.  Gone are the Christian girl autumn booties that, as much as we make fun, are objectively a cozy comfy pumpkin-spiced slay.  Out of the shadows of these eras rises a new shoe, a shoe from humble beginnings that proved to be up to the task of meeting all the demands the life of a white woman could throw at it.  It did not tremble at the foot traffic of the organic farmer’s market.  It braved five mile hikes, two hours worth of post-pilates sweat, and a yoga retreat all in one weekend.  A white woman could go to the bathroom and find that her shoe had ordered her a caesar salad and a side of fries by the time she’d gotten back.  Who was this new hero?  The sensible shoe.

Tevas, Chacos, Birkenstalks, and Doc Martens (but in a purely heterosexual fashion) have begun sprouting up on white women’s feet in every corner of the market.  Sporty white women, preppy white women, those white women obsessed with nature who don’t shower, straight, gay, bisexual, and healthily bicurious white women, and even those white women with she/they in their bios who still identify as cis women have all become captivated by the sensible shoe craze.

But to simply don these comfy footwear only constitutes one half of the experience.  The crucial second component is the exhibition of such shoes to other white women in the near vicinity.  This is how the white woman builds community and, of course, through establishing whose footwear is indeed the most sensible, determines the alpha of the pack.

They were bought on sale, or better yet, thrifted, though she has the money to buy new.  She did not wash the previous owner’s foot sweat from the soles of those Tevas, because she feels that the mingling of their bodily fluids is a kind of intimate communion that intertwines their souls through soles.  She gave her entire gym athlete’s foot.

Lead scholars in the field of white woman studies have connected this alpha ritual to an ancient prophetic legend.  The prophecy foretells of a white woman with the most sensible shoes in the universe.  She wanders the globe with ne’er a blister, nor a callous, with arches high enough to shelter a small family of field mice.  According to legend, when this white woman emerges, chosen out of scores of sensibly shodden alpha white women, she will be the one to lead them all.

This rise is the sensible-shoed white woman can only signify one thing: they are preparing for war.  War against what, you ask?  War against the greatest injustice that has ever befallen the human race in the history of mankind: improper arch support.

So if you are a lover of flat-footed shoes like Vans or Chuck Taylors, or perhaps a little more dangerous as a wearer of platforms, wedges, or even stripper heels, beware; the white women are coming.  They are on a mission to save your feet from your hedonistic footwear and convert you to the sensible shoe gospel.  Your dogs have been warned.

articles.title: Why Did No One Tell Me the Woke Left
articles.description: Anyways. I have been sitting, coveredddddd in barbeque sauce for like 20 minutes patiently waiting for the woke mob to come get me
articles.content:
Why Did No One Tell Me the Woke Left


Dear Diary,

Today I couldn’t find my diary, so I’m writing this on both of my Kung Fu Panda 2 DVDs. Anyways. I have been sitting, coveredddddd in barbeque sauce for like 20 minutes patiently waiting for the woke mob to come get me. They love licking me clean.

We do this once a week every Thursday at 4:30. They love my barbeque sauce. I make it fresh every Thursday morning for them. I get soooooo excited on Thursdays even my roommates can see it! This morning I popped out of my bed and skipped over to the kitchen and my roommate went “hey um what are you wearing lol”. I went “my special barbeque sauce outfit for the woke!”, she went “what does that mean?”. I told her the story. I told her the origin story actually.

I told her how one day I was people watching in the commons. I told her I spilled a little of my fresh homemade barbeque sauce on me and like 10 wokes came to lick it clean. It was so fun and it felt nice. She said “you’re so fucking weird what the fuck” super judgmentally. It was kind of upsetting. Sad face. But no worries! I get to be licked so soon! I walk towards the door, but forget my goodbye kiss from my roommate, so I scurry back over to the kitchen and then after our five minute fiery passionate goodbye kiss, I walk out the door. I skip. I am practically floating on air. I sit on my park bench and I smotherrrrrrr myself in barbeque sauce.

I wait TEN minutes. No one. Not a soul comes to give me a lil lick. So there I am sat, covered in sauce that will seemingly never be licked off my body. I begin to believe I am the problem. Why does no one care about my body barbeque? I sit there thinking and I shed a tear. I check my phone to see what is popping on the Gram and I see that the woke left. Diary, this was the worst thing I could have seen. Not only were they not there to lick off my saucy saucy body today, but they never will be again. Times like these. They really make you think. Stay safe out there man you never know when the ones you love will leave.

XOXO,

Bbq girl <3
